algorithm_technique: Depth First Search (DFS) or Breadth First Search (BFS) to traverse rooms
problem_summary_simple: Can you visit all rooms starting from room 0, given keys found in each room?
problem_summary_technical: Graph traversal problem where rooms are nodes and keys are directed edges. Use DFS/BFS to check reachability of all nodes.
key_insights: This problem can be modeled as a graph traversal where rooms are nodes and keys are edges.
A set is efficient for keeping track of visited rooms to avoid cycles and redundant processing.
The goal is to determine if all nodes in the graph are reachable from the starting node (room 0).
